title: Man Utd boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer heaps praise on Chelsea young stars
text:
Solskjaer says United’s youngsters are behind Chelsea’s (Picture: Getty)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer believes Chelsea are reaping the rewards of sending their star youngsters out on loan.

Chelsea and Manchester United go toe-to-toe on Wednesday night in the Carabao Cup, with both sides expected to field young sides.

Frank Lampard has relied on his academy stars amid a transfer ban and Solskjaer conceded Chelsea’s youngsters are step ahead United’s young talent.

‘Chelsea are a very exciting team,’ he said.

Lampard has built his team around Chelsea’s young stars (Picture: Getty)

‘Frank has got players that have been on loan for one or two seasons in the Championship.

‘The difference between my youngsters is that they are almost stepping right now onto the scene.

‘Axel Tuanzebe has missed the last couple of games, but he has been out on loan (at Aston Villa last season) and you can see the benefit.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I think Chelsea’s young players benefit from that now. They are a mature young team.’

James Garner, 18, and Brandon Williams, 19, are expected to play against Chelsea.

Solskjaer has been forced to promote several youngsters to his first team due to injures, but the United boss has been pleased with the response.

Garner is expected to play against Chelsea (Picture: Getty)

‘Character will be revealed in tough times, but I think the young kids have been excellent,’ he said.

‘I can’t give them any more responsibility and I couldn’t be any more happy with many of the youngsters.

‘We know it’s been tough, and we know that we have asked a lot of them because Paul (Pogba), Luke (Shaw), Anthony (Martial) and loads of other players have been injured.

‘The youngsters have stepped up in a difficult period. But in the end they will be stronger for it.’

MORE: Manchester United ‘expected to complete Erling Haaland signing’ as Napoli pull out of transfer race
description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer believes there is one major difference between Manchester United's young stars and Chelsea's.
